content.description: This burly climb is a lot of fun. It starts with hand stack burly move into a ~10 foot wide roof crack of 4" to 8". Pull around the lip and continue up more wide crack (crux) for a few moves before gaining the head wall and somewhat easier technical climbing above. There is no anchor. Build an anchor at the boulder.
content.protection: Double set from .4 to #5 camalot (or one #5 and one #6) and a few medium nuts. A handful of quickdraws,
content.location: Once into Brumley Canyon you'll locate this obvious line as the wide crask that splits a wide pillar. To access the climb choose a path of least resistance down to the creek and back up the other side, bushwacking a fair bit. The start of the climb is at an obvious rock shelf/ledge. Shimmy up on top of the ledge and you'll be able to see the wide crack start just above your head.
